discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Syn-ack signifies and SSH connection was successful on port 22.

Selected Answer: A
Did they mean to do “sun-ack” on port 23 and not 22 which would make more sense since 22 is secure shell and port 23 is Telnet and NOT secure meaning a breach is more likely…?

I don't know what to look for here. port 23 failed, port 22 syn-ack and port 3389 just syn. Don't know how to come to the conclusion any of these was the breach... I'm just assumming its RDP cause it tried twice??

comments.content: it is "ssh", he got a syn-ack from port 22 which means connection established
It's C. You could see that Port 23 was RST which means it was terminated and port 22 is Syn-ack which means it was established

choices.C: Firewalls on the software development servers
choices.D: Longer and more complex password requirements

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Employee changed role in this example. Seems pretty straightforward.

Selected Answer: B
It's B. 

RBAC: "Hey, you're on the Sales team, not the Dev team. We're denying your access to the code repository now.".

Patching Policy: "Hey, no more choosing when you want Windows updates. You now get them on the second Tuesday of the month when they're released."

Selected Answer: B
Gonna go with B over A, since employee's role changed, it makes sense he should no longer have access to the code anymore to make changes thus RBAC.

Selected Answer: A
Role based access control

Selected Answer: B
Role-based access control (RBAC) is a method of regulating access to computer or network resources based on the roles of individual users within an enterprise. In this context, roles are defined according to job competency, authority, and responsibility within the enterprise. Implementing RBAC will ensure that users only have the access necessary to fulfill their current roles. So, if a user changes roles, their access permissions change accordingly, preventing them from accessing systems or performing actions that are not relevant to their current role.

Selected Answer: A
GPT says B. ExamTopics says B. So it's probably B, but A also seems like it could be the answer cause patches get reviewed and new code being pushed would be reviewed and denied if noticed it was out of scope of the current sprint.

questions.question_text: A software developer changed positions within a company and is now a sales engineer. The security team discovered that the former software developer had been modifying code to implement small features requested by customers. Which of the following would be the best thing for the security administrator to implement to prevent this from happening?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
PoE injectors should be able to power the AP

questions.question_text: An IT intern moved the location of a WAP from one conference room to another. The WAP was unable to boot following the move. Which of the following should be used to fix the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
CVE stands for **Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures**. It is a standardized identifier for publicly known cybersecurity vulnerabilities. Each CVE entry contains an identification number, a description of the vulnerability, and references to related information. CVEs help organizations prioritize and address vulnerabilities across various systems and software by providing a consistent naming convention and detailed information.

questions.question_text: A trusted vendor emailed a security advisory to an engineer. The advisory listed publicly disclosed security issues and resolutions for the vendor's installed network devices. Which of the following describes this security concept?

A network technician for a bank configured a WLAN that provides good coverage. Bank employees are now reporting Wi-Fi issues when the microwave in the lunch room area is used. Which of the following frequencies should the technician use to minimize interference?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Microwaves typically operate at around 2.4GHz, so using the 5GHz frequency for the WLAN can help minimize interference from the microwave.
